types.description: Channel mutations.

fields.name: createChannel
fields.description: Creates a channel.

inputFields.name: context
inputFields.description: Defines the action that the control panel performs after the user clicks the App Extension label.

inputFields.name: label
inputFields.description: The locale-aware link text options for the App Extension's menu item. The control panel user sees this text value wherever they have the option to open the App Extension.

inputFields.name: model
inputFields.description: The entity type to which the App Extension relates; for example, Orders. The model corresponds with the page on which the App Extension appears.

inputFields.name: url
inputFields.description: A relative path with some meaning to your app, most commonly an internally-defined GET route. The path should contain a path parameter that the app expects to be templated into its route, defined as a JavaScript string template expression. For example, `/customer/auth/${id}`. Currently, `id` is the only supported parameter. Limit 255 characters.

fields.name: appExtension
fields.description: The response object properties available after creating an App Extension.

inputFields.name: externalId
inputFields.description: Associated ID within a system / platform outside of BC.

inputFields.name: isListableFromUi
inputFields.description: Indicates if a channel can create listings from the BigCommerce UI. Default value for this field is based on the channel type and platform combination if not specified on create.

inputFields.name: isVisible
inputFields.description: Indicates if a channel is visible within the BigCommerce merchant admin UI (control panel). If false, the channel will not show in Channel Manager nor in any channels dropdown throughout the UI. Default value for this field is true if not specified on create.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Name of the channel as it will appear to merchants in the control panel.

inputFields.name: platform
inputFields.description: The name of the platform for the channel; channel platform and type must be a valid combination. Please visit https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-reference/store-management/channels#platform to check for valid combination.

inputFields.name: status
inputFields.description: The status of the channel; channel type, platform, and status must be a valid combination. Please visit https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-reference/store-management/channels#status to check for valid combination. terminated is not valid for CREATE or UPDATE requests. deleted is not valid for CREATE requests.

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description: The type of channel; channel platform and type must be a valid combination. Please visit https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-reference/store-management/channels#platform to check for valid combination.

types.name: AppExtension
types.description: The response object for any query or mutation that returns an App Extension.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the object.

fields.name: context
fields.description: Defines the action that the control panel performs after the user clicks the App Extension label.

fields.name: label
fields.description: The locale-aware options for the App Extension menu item link text.

fields.name: model
fields.description: The entity type to which the App Extension relates; for example, Orders.

fields.name: url
fields.description: A relative path with some meaning to your app, most commonly an internally-defined GET route. The path should contain a supported path parameter that the app expects to be templated into its route, defined as a JavaScript string template literal. For example, '/customer/auth/${id}'. Currently, `id` is the only supported parameter. Limit 255 characters.

types.name: AppExtensionContext
types.description: Defines the action that the control panel performs after the user clicks the App Extension label.

enumValues.name: LINK
enumValues.description: The control panel navigates the user away from their current page to the parent app's page, where the app can render App Extension-specific content.

enumValues.name: PANEL
enumValues.description: The control panel opens a side panel on the user's current page, where the app can render content without navigating away.

types.name: AppExtensionLabel
types.description: An object that contains locale-aware link text for the App Extension URL. The control panel user sees this link text wherever they have the option to open the App Extension.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: The link text that the user sees when the control panel language is English or a language for which the developer has not defined a label in `label.locales`. The `defaultValue` should be in English.  Suggested length of ≤25 characters; limit 255 characters.

fields.name: locales
fields.description: The list of locale-aware link text options for an App Extension, excluding the defaultValue.

types.name: AppExtensionLabelLocale
types.description: The locale-specific link text and corresponding locales for an App Extension.

fields.name: localeCode
fields.description: The locale code for the link text; for example, `pt-BR` for Portuguese. The locale code should correspond with a control panel-supported language. See the App Extensions documentation for a list of currently supported languages and corresponding locale codes.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The link text that the user sees when the control panel language corresponds with the accompanying locale code.  Suggested length of ≤25 characters; limit 255 characters.

types.name: AppExtensionModel
types.description: The entity type to which an App Extension relates. The path parameter templated into the App Extension URL takes a model property as its argument. For example, an App Extension active on the CUSTOMERS model converts `/auth/${id}` into `/auth/227` for the customer whose ID value is 227.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMERS
enumValues.description: The App Extension appears on the supported customer-related pages and takes Customer properties as arguments.

enumValues.name: ORDERS
enumValues.description: The App Extension appears on the supported orders-related pages and takes Orders properties as arguments.

enumValues.name: PRODUCTS
enumValues.description: The App Extension appears on the supported products-related pages and takes Products properties as arguments.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_DESCRIPTION
enumValues.description: The App Extension appears on the description field on supported Edit Products pages and takes Products properties as arguments.

fields.description: Indicates if a channel is visible within the BigCommerce merchant admin UI (control panel). If false, the channel will not show in Channel Manager nor in any channels dropdown throughout the UI. Default value for this field is true if not specified on create.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL’s execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

fields.name: isRepeatable
fields.description: Permits using the directive multiple times at the same location.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Long
types.description: The `Long` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Long can represent values between -(2^63) and 2^63 - 1.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
